preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 3. The aims of the metabolomics study and its investigation goals, hypotheses, and assumptions.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 3. The aims of the metabolomics study and its investigation goals, hypotheses, and assumptions.

externalSourcesList.description: Scott, I. M., C. P. Vermeer, et al. (2010). "Enhancement of Plant Metabolite Fingerprinting by Machine Learning." Plant Physiology 153(4): 1506-1520.
lynn Presentation about the experimental design of HiMet Project
Maria Likata Presentation about the acquired data in HiMet Project

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 4. The domain expert requirements regarding the presentation knowledge.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 4. The domain expert requirements regarding the presentation knowledge.

preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 5. Background knowledge/information regarding knowledge presentation recommended facilities, features, and best practices (see section 4.5).

externalSourcesList.description: BaniMustafa, A. (2012). A Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining Process Model for Metabolomics. PhD, University of Wales, Aberystwyth.
Kantardzic, M. (2003). Data mining: concepts, models, methods, and algorithms. Hoboken, NJ, Wiley-Interscience : IEEE Press.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 6. Background knowledge/information regarding the available knowledge representation methods, techniques and tools (see section 6.2.8).
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 6. Background knowledge/information regarding the available knowledge representation methods, techniques and tools (see section 6.2.8).

externalSourcesList.description: BaniMustafa, A. H. and N. W. Hardy (2012). A Strategy for Selecting Data Mining Techniques in Metabolomics (in press). Plant Metabolomics: Methods and Protocols. N. W. Hardy and R. D. Hall, Springer Science. 860: 317-335.
Kantardzic, M. (2003). Data mining: concepts, models, methods, and algorithms. Hoboken, NJ, Wiley-Interscience : IEEE Press.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 7. The requirements of knowledge presentation tools, including: software tools, hard- ware and expertise as well as other necessary information regarding the model in- puts, parameters and expected outputs, as well as the constraints of their application.
